Where traceability is a requirement, the quality plan should define its scope and extent, including how the affected products will be identified. The quality plan should state: a) how contractual, statutory and regulatory traceability requirements are identified and incorporated into working documents; b) what records relating to such traceability requirements will be generated and how they will be controlled and distributed; c) specific requirements and methods for the identification of the inspection and test status of products.
